alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 6:38PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL HOT SPRINGS... SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN AND WESTERN WASHAKIE COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 638 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Shell to 7 miles southwest of Manderson to 8 miles west of Lucerne. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manderson, Kirby, Shell, and Winchester around 645 PM MDT. Worland, Lucerne, and Wyoming Boys School around 650 PM MDT. Shell Canyon around 655 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Worland Municipal Airport and Shell Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
